author: Alessandro V
text:
Grailed refused my appeal to be unbanned because apparently i “repeatedly relisted the items after being taken down multiple times” when this isn’t the truth. I NEVER resisted an item after being told it was inauthentic besides when grailed emailed me TELLING ME TO RELIST with “tagging” or a “clearer picture” *at this point grailed didn’t officially say that the item was inauthentic* (i just assumed that grailed needed more pics not that they were telling me that my item was fake!). Can you guys PLEASE reconsider being this harsh on me and at least let me BUY ONLY on the app?? This was literally a MISTAKE! Could you guys give the benefit of the doubt to a customer of 4 YEARS when i tell you guys that I really had no idea that the items were inauthentic? I know listing inauthentic items is against TOS but i’m convinced that most of the items we’re indeed authentic. (I might even be able to find email receipts from the web store that some of the items were bought from). Even if they did happen to be inauthentic i promise you guys that I had absolutely NO KNOWLEDGE of this. Another thing that astonished me is that in grailed’s response to my original review they told me that i’ve listed multiple fake bape pieces as well as various other brands but the ONLY bape peice i ever posted WAS SOLD AND HAD A DIGITALLY AUTHENTICATED BADGE from you guys and was never taken down! This really makes no sense to me, I really hope you can reconsider because this isn’t the way to treat a loyal customer that made a simple mistake. The fact that I believed that items that I bought on grailed were authentic and felt no need to legit check them before posting shouldn’t be held against me. If the item wasn’t taken down from the original seller I bought it from on grailed then why should it be taken down when I relist! You guys didn’t even give me a single warning before deciding to completely perm ban me. All I ask for is 1 more chance, i assure you guys that this kind of misunderstanding will never happen again. Again my usernames are @_alealeale and @alessandrov
By the way: I also ended up GETTING RID OF THESE ITEMS through a different app so you won’t ever have to worry about me relisting any of those pieces (that you guys claim are “inauthentic”) on Grailed.
Thanks For Your Time
title: Grailed Refuses To Unban Me When I’ve Done Nothing Wrong

author: Paul
text:
This website seems so cool at first, so many cool items listed there. A few weeks ago, I purchased from their platform for the first time, a vintage Moncler ski jacket. The listing mentioned "size WOMENS L" but I didn't really care, the measurements were good for me and the jacket looked cool, not feminine at all. Once I received it, I didn't like it as much as I did in the pictures. The seller doesn't want it back, that's fair. I decide to relist it. One day later, Grailed sends me an email telling me they removed it because it's womenswear. Lol this seems completely moronic to me. I was able to purchase an item on this website that was not flagged and removed by their curators, so I expect to be able to resell it on that very same platform if I want to. I didn't change a single word from the first listing when I tried to resell it, so it's really beyond me why they didn't take it down a loooong time ago if it was against their rules. What an amateurish job. 

Obviously I contacted the customer service. Two weeks ago for the first time, and a few times since. Never heard back once from them. 

I wish I had read the some of the reviews here before I took a chance with them ! Well, you live and you learn. I'm never going near that website ever again :D.

EDIT - Thanks for the reply. My username is richeverland683. At this point I kinda expect you're gonna tell me you can't do anything, but it feels a little bit less frustrating to finally hear from you.

EDIT EDIT - I changed my one star rating to a 3 star one, since they corrected their mistake. Still, I wish we could have done it sooner through their customer service.
title: Resolved - cannot resell an item purchased on their platform

I never relisted ANY of these items unless grailed asked me for a clearer picture of a specific part of the garment. I don't understand what they get out of being ridiculously harsh on loyal customers that spend thousands of dollars MONTHLY on their app. This is just unfair... I would understand a ban of a few weeks or even a few months but a PERMANENT ban over a single mistake is just stupid. I don't see what the harm is in giving me one more chance or banning me from SELLING on the app while letting me continue to buy. You guys also just need to add more support in general (for example: a line that people can call where you actually talk to someone *not some prerecorded voicemail*). I also already sold all of these items on a separate app so I really have no need to continue selling on grailed.
